Saturday, June 14, 2025
7:00‚ÄØPM
11:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Moonlight Movies
is a fun, family event! Bring a blanket, a chair  or both and enjoy the night time breeze while watching a movie at our Bandshell in gorgeous Hernando Park! The event is
FREE
to the public and includes
FREE
downtown parking and the opportunity to stroll throughout downtown enjoying restaurants, merchants, and retail stores!
There will also be food trucks, arts and crafts merchants and a few other surprises!
Space Jam
All-Star Adventure!
Everyone should come wearing your favorite basketball (or any sport) jersey!
Monster Dunk Contest
:¬†Participants can attempt their best slam dunks using a low hoop and foam basketballs.
Space Jam Dribble Relay
: Participants race while dribbling a basketball around cones.

Brooksville Tangerine Festival
Saturday, February 15, 2025
11:00‚ÄØAM
8:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
The
Inaugural Tangerine Festival
is a
FREE EVENT
with
VIP PERKS
that marks the beginning of a new tradition in Brooksville, celebrating the area‚Äôs rich agricultural history and its enduring connection to Florida‚Äôs citrus industry.
This year‚Äôs event will feature:
Live Music:
Downtown Brooksville will be rocking all day with back-to-back performances on two stages packed with live music! Enjoy a lineup of local bands and headlining performers, ensuring there‚Äôs something for every music lover. Get ready to dance, sing, and celebrate our veterans with an unforgettable day of music!
Bandshell in Hernando Park:
11:30am-1:30pm
Draw 4
2:30pm-4:30pm
WOR Women of Rock Tribute Band
5:30pm-7:30pm
Southbound 75
‚ÄúHomegrown‚Äù Stage
12pm-7pm ‚Äì
Performances by local musicians, dance troops and artists, including genres from rock and country to blues and patriotic tunes.
Tangerine Treasure Market:
A vibrant market featuring local arts, crafts, and retail vendors offering a wide variety of unique goods. From handcrafted jewelry and artwork to custom-made clothing, home d√©cor, and specialty gifts, there's something for everyone.
Family Fun Zone:
Fun for all ages awaits! Enjoy exciting photo opportunities throughout the event, face painting, balloon art, and a captivating magician performing tricks that will delight both kids and adults. The zone will also include a Bubble Foam Party! Fun for the entire family!
Tangerine-Inspired Treats:
Indulge in culinary creations featuring tangerines, from pizzas and jams to refreshing drinks from our downtown restaurants and local food trucks.
Tangerine Education:
Learn about the history of tangerine farming in Brooksville
through interactive displays and demonstrations.
Tangerine Royalty Pageant:
Join us as we crown the first-ever Tangerine Festival King & Queen (50+), Ms & Mr Tangerine Royale (18-49), Teen Ms & Mr Tangerine (14-17) , Junior Miss & Mr Tangerine (10-13), Little Ms & Mr Tangerine (6-9), Teenie Tot Tangerine (3-5), Tangerine Cuties (under 2) and Tangerine Tail-Wagger (Pet)! Contestant Registration is now open-
CLICK HERE!
Car Show Extravaganza
Get ready to rev your engines! A one-of-a-kind car show featuring an incredible lineup of vehicles from the 1900s to the present day. Whether you‚Äôre a fan of vintage charm, high-performance muscle, or modern elegance, there‚Äôs something for everyone!
VIP Description:
Experience the Tangerine Festival in style with our exclusive VIP tickets! Enjoy special perks and premium access while celebrating all things tangerine during this inaugural community event.
VIP Ticket Experience Includes:
üçä All day access to the VIP Tangerine Lounge
üçä Reserved seating near the main stage
üçä Enjoy Complimentary Sips and Snacks with a Tangerine Twist
üçä Commemorate the event with a Free Festival Memento
... and a few other surprises!
Date: Saturday, Feb 15th ¬†11am-8pm
Location: Downtown Brooksville- Hernando Bandshell 205 E Ft Dade
Pre Event:¬† $50 per person/ $85 per couple
Event Day:¬† $65 person/ $115 per couple
Celebrate the zest of life with us at the Tangerine Festival!
üçä
Click here to purchase VIP tickets

Proud Members
MADE WITH ‚ô• BY
ROOTS CREATIVE CO.

Dawn Triconi, Executive Director
Dawn is one who is passionate about serving a purpose greater than self. She is genuinely dedicated to understanding others, which naturally builds and nurtures personal and professional relationships. She is an accomplished, goal-driven professional with over 25 years of experience in the Operations, Marketing, Accounting and Non-Profit sectors. With extensive experience managing multiple projects, Dawn has a proven track record of delivering, planning and executing marketing campaigns and events.
Dawn served as finance director for United Way of Hernando County. Moving to new opportunities, she accepted a position with Greater Hernando County Chamber of Commerce as their event coordinator and later was promoted to Director of Operations. More recently, Dawn spent four years in Wolfeboro, New Hampshire enjoying life on Lake Winnipesaukee, while serving as the Executive Director for Intown Concord producing events and programs that encouraged economic vitality to downtown Concord NH. ¬†She‚Äôs excited to be part of the Brooksville Main Street community and is looking forward to the many adventures that await!
Staff
Cassandra Brockway, Event Director
Cassandra is an accomplished Operations Manager with a proven track record in the stock transfer industry, specializing in project management and operational leadership. With a keen ability to streamline processes and drive efficiency, Cassandra has consistently delivered impactful results in fast-paced environments. In addition to her professional expertise, she is deeply committed to the Brooksville community, bringing energy and vitality to local initiatives. As a leader, she combines strategic vision with a passion for fostering growth and collaboration, both in her workplace and within her community.
Cassandra grew up in England, moving to the U.S. in 2014 she brought with her a fresh perspective and a global approach to her professional career. Her journey from England to the U.S. has shaped her unique perspective on leadership, community, and the value of diverse experiences in both her professional and personal life. She looks forward to working with Brooksville Main Street to work to add to the charm of Brooksville.
2025 Board of Directors
Christopher Rhodes, Board President & Design Committee Co-Chair
Although Chris only moved to Brooksville from Hudson in 2021, he has been visiting it for decades. He is a mental health therapist by trade and a historic preservationist by passion. His spare time is spent renovating his over 100-year-old home in our South Brooksville Avenue Historic District and in photographing our city. Chris shares his home with his loving wife Lauren, their dog, five cats (3 of which came with his home). His favorite BMS event is Christmas on Main, which he can walk to as it is just a couple of blocks from his home. However, the Tangerine Ball Drop may be coming in at a close second!
Jody Young, Board Vice-President
Jody first came to Brooksville in the 1980s when her parents bought a home here and then moved here herself in 1999. Jody's career for many years involved serving in local government finance/administration but has most recently begun working for Edmunds GovTech as a Customer Support Specialist Level III providing financial software support to governmental clients around the country.
Jody loves both national and international travel, but also very much enjoys fishing locally on their boat and spending time outdoors on the Adventure Coast with her husband Brent, three adult sons, 2 grandchildren, and their sweet dog Molly. Christmas on Main Street events are her favorite BMS-hosted activities; she loves the physical transformation of the downtown as well as the joy the activities bring to all those who attend.
Amanda Cunningham-Rud, Board Secretary
Amanda was raised in rural Northwest Indiana near Chicago. Early in life, Amanda was exposed to the concept of public service as her grandfather and other family members served the State of Indiana in various elected roles. She moved to Florida with her husband in 2011.  Over the next several years, Amanda quickly noticed Brooksville Main Street partnering with the City of Brooksville, Hernando County, and local businesses to enrich the community. She wanted to be part of that, so she started volunteering for BMS in different capacities. She saw a call out for board members and applied. Amanda joined the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors in 2021.
Amanda currently works full-time as a public school teacher at Brooksville Elementary School. She is a member of the American Legion Auxiliary Unit 99 and serves on the City of Brooksville‚Äôs Parks and Recreation and Beautification Boards. ‚ÄúI donate my time and talent to Brooksville Main Street because I want my son and our community‚Äôs kids to be proud of their hometown. There‚Äôs something special about Brooksville and I have no doubt that Brooksville Main Street is and will play a key role in fostering Brooksville‚Äôs success.‚Äù
Keith Marcelle, Board Treasurer & Organization Committee Co-Chair
Keith is the proud owner of Marcelle Enterprises LLC. He graduated from LSU in 1998 and has lived in Hernando County since 2005. Keith values his family and friends above all else and greatly enjoys connecting with our community through all of our local events.
Mandi Dixon,  Board Member
Mandi is a dynamic force in the music and entertainment industry with a profound love for small towns and historic buildings.
While in Nashville, she took her love for music and culture to the next level by founding Mandolin Entertainment, a venture where she worked closely with acclaimed artists and continued to make a mark in the industry. Her experiences in Nashville only deepened her affection for the rich history and unique architecture found in the city's historic buildings.
After returning to Florida in 2018, Mandi embraced motherhood, and small-town life while falling in love with historic preservation.
Mandi's expertise spans management, branding, public relations, and event management, making her a respected figure in the industry. Her unique blend of professional acumen and heartfelt appreciation for the beauty of small towns and historic buildings sets her apart as a dynamic and multifaceted individual in the world of music and entertainment.
Lee Johnson, Board Member
Lee has been involved in the city since 1998, living downtown and running a BMS district business, Downtown Loser, with her spouse, Celeste.  They have four adult children, six grandchildren, and two dogs Sophie and Coco.  Lee likes playing the ukulele and pickleball, and also enjoys traveling and photography.  Her favorite BMS program is Friday Night Live (which takes place in Hernando Park so she could play pickleball or play the ukulele or take photos while she enjoys the concert)!
Barbara Manuel, Board Member
Barbara came to Brooksville in 1966 when she married her husband, Steve. He worked at HHS as Band Director and she taught Chorus for many years, but when they retired, they took over the local radio station.  They‚Äôve expanded that to three stations over the years, and in her spare time, Barbara managed the inaugural BMS Promotion Committee and single-handedly raised $46,000 for our holiday decorations. That makes the December activities Barbara‚Äôs favorite BMS program and she loves watching how much people enjoy downtown during that time.
Shalamar McNair, Board Member
Shalamar moved to Brooksville when he was five andgraduated from Hernando High School in 2000. He left that year and has been back for 14 years. In the last four years he has turned to a sober life (May 3, 2020) and has been VERY active in the community since.
He was the main stage DJ at Lead Foot City, before construction started. He is the main DJ for Hernando County Boys & Girls Club. He is a member of the Greater Chamber of Commerce of Hernando County. Last he owns his own business, Shal‚Äôs Mobile Services Inc and DJ Shalamar - a DJ and entertainment company.
He‚Äôs been DJ‚Äôing for 24 years and also holds a Masters in Executive Management! In his owns words ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited to be apart of the Brooksville Main Street board because my life now is all about the pay it forward vibes and giving back to the community.‚Äù
‚ÄúLet make memories through gathering in our beautiful community of Brooksville, Florida.‚Äù
Justin Noe, Board Member & Economic Vitality Chair
WIth years of experience investing, buying and selling homes across the country, Justin‚Äôs dream has been to share his knowedge and expertise with others on their way to achieving their own real estate dreams.
He is a husband and father first, as well as a Marine Corps Veteran with more than 20 years of honorable service.
Justin is an active real estate agent at Agile Group Realty in the Nature Coast area, a real estate investor, a co-founder of Twin Pillars Investments, Brooksville Investment Group and the Real Estate Co-Op. He grew up in Brookville and joined the Marines at age 18. The Noe‚Äôs journey moved them cross-country 4 times, to 6 diferent states, 14 different homes before returning to his hometown.
Jennifer Rey, Board member & Organization Committee Co-Chair
Jennifer has been in Brooksville since 1986, with a few years in the middle spent in Wyoming.  She is Managing Partner at Hogan Law Firm..  She is always willing to lend a hand unless the Tampa Lightning is playing - then we have to wait!  Jennifer most enjoys our Christmas on Main Tree Lighting and organizing kids‚Äô activities in the Hogan garage during BMS events.
Christie Williams, Board Member & Design Committee Co-Chair
Christie has lived in Brooksville her entire life. Go Leopards! For the past seven years, she has been an active member of the Greater Hernando Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors and is proud to be serving as Board Chair for 2024.  She currently serves as a Board Member for BMS as well as Design Committee Co-Chair.
Christie has a degree in Commercial Art and Graphic Design, along with  20+ years of Parks and Recreation experience combined with more than 35 years of Hospitality. She currently works for the City of Brooksville as Retreat Manager of Chinsegut Hill Retreat.
This past year, while serving on the Promotions Committee, she jumped in with both feet by taking on a lead role  for BMS‚Äôs Christmas on Main Street celebration!
Christmas on Main Street holds a special place in her heart. Her great grandmother used to play Santa Claus, and some of Christie‚Äôs cherished memories are from those festive days. Bringing that same joy and magic to our community is incredibly meaningful to her.
She‚Äôs excited to serve on the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and looks forward to continuing to make our town a wonderful place to live and celebrate.  Being part of the "Brooksville Renaissance‚Äù, she can't wait to share her vision with the community!
Casey Thieryung, Board Member & Promotions Committee Chair
As a
lifelong resident of Brooksville, Casey is a committed community leader, local business owner, and passionate advocate for historic preservation. He owns the Red Mule Pub, a landmark sandwich shop that has served the community for over 45 years, and brings years of local knowledge and experience to the Brooksville Main Street board.
A former member of the Brooksville City Council and active member of the Brooksville Rotary Club, Casey has a long-standing record of civic involvement. He also holds an FAA Part 107 drone pilot license, bringing a modern and innovative perspective to community development. Above all, he is proud to raise his family in the town he loves‚Äîwith his wife, their daughter, and a second child on the way. Casey is honored to help shape a vibrant and enduring future for downtown Brooksville.
Dawn Triconi, Executive Director
Dawn is one who is passionate about serving a purpose greater than self. She is genuinely dedicated to understanding others, which naturally builds and nurtures personal and professional relationships. She is an accomplished, goal-driven professional with over 25 years of experience in the Operations, Marketing, Accounting and Non-Profit sectors. Jody loves both national and international travel, but also very much enjoys fishing locally on their boat and spending time outdoors on the Adventure Coast with her husband Brent, three adult sons, 2 grandchildren, and their sweet dog Molly. Christmas on Main Street events are her favorite BMS-hosted activities; she loves the physical transformation of the downtown as well as the joy the activities bring to all those who attend.

About Us
We are Main Street.
As a Main Street America‚Ñ¢ Accredited program, Brooksville Main Street is a recognized leading program among the national network of more than 1,200 neighborhoods and communities who share both a commitment to creating high-quality places and to building stronger communities through preservation-based economic development. All Main Street America‚Ñ¢ Accredited programs meet a set of National Accreditation Standards of Performance as outlined by¬†Main Street America.
Brooksville Main Street is a nonprofit organization that is also an accredited member of Florida Main Street, a division of the Florida Department of State.¬† A maximum of three cities per year are chosen for Main Street America designation. Brooksville earned theirs in late 2016 officially starting the program in 2017.

Main Street Transformation Strategies are implemented through comprehensive work in four broad areas, known as the Four Points.
Economic Vitality
Economic vitality is about smart growth. It focuses on capital, incentives, and other economic and financial tools to assist new and existing businesses, catalyze property development, and create a supportive environment for entrepreneurs and innovators that drive local economies.
Learn more
Design
Design is about beautification. It supports a community‚Äôs transformation by enhancing the physical and visual assets that set the commercial district apart.
Learn more
Organization
Organization is about collaboration. It involves creating a strong foundation for a sustainable revitalization effort, including cultivating partnerships, community involvement, and resources for the district.
Learn more
Promotion
Promotion is about placemaking. It positions the downtown or commercial district as the center of the community and hub of economic activity while creating a positive image that showcases a community‚Äôs unique characteristics.
Learn more
Main Street America
began in 1980 as an innovative way to revitalize downtown areas.¬† The philosophy worked, and since then has been used in communities across America to make downtowns (and thus their cities) healthy.
Florida Main Street
provides oversight for the programs in our state. They provide training, development, and important networking invaluable to us.
What is the Main Street District?
Brooksville Main Street‚Äô District has the same boundaries as the City Community Redevelopment Agency (
view map
). Businesses and residences in the district qualify for special grants, promotions, and assistance from both BMS and the City of Brooksville.
‚ÄúNever doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.‚Äù
- Margaret Mead

Google Calendar
ICS
Brooksville Main Street Announces Exciting Downtown Spring Street Market
Brooksville Main Street is thrilled to announce the upcoming
Downtown Spring Street Market
, set to take place on
Saturday, March 15th
in the heart of historic downtown Brooksville. This vibrant, family-friendly and pet-friendly market will bring together local artisans, farmers, crafters, and small businesses for a lively celebration of the season.
The Spring Street Market will feature a variety of vendors offering fresh produce, handcrafted goods, artwork, boutique clothing, home d√©cor, and more. Visitors can enjoy delicious food from local restaurants and food trucks and downtown activities.
The market will take place along
S Brooksville Ave and Liberty Street by the Water Tower in downtown Brooksville
from
10am to 2pm
. Visitors are encouraged to stroll through the market, explore downtown shops, and enjoy the beautiful spring atmosphere.
Join us for a day of shopping, entertainment, and community spirit at the Downtown Spring Street Market!
Vendor applications are now open for those interested in participating. Spaces are limited, so early registration is recommended. For more information or to apply, visit
https://www.welovebvl.org/event-applications
For more information visit
www.welovebvl.org
or visit the BMS Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/brooksvillemainstreet/

Pedal Play Day 2025
Saturday, March 22, 2025
11:00‚ÄØAM
2:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Pedal Play Day Rolls into Brooksville to  Celebrate the Good Neighbor Trail
Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida‚Äôs Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host
Pedal Play Day
, a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail.
Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to join us on
Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm
in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun.
Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism.
The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your bike and helmet!
We‚Äôll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths.
This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others.

Saturday, December 6, 2025
3:00‚ÄØPM
9:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Step into a holiday wonderland as downtown Brooksville transforms into a magical scene straight out of your favorite Hallmark movie! Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs in store for this unforgettable evening:
Sounds of the Season
Stroll the streets with our enchanting Street Carolers, serenading you with your favorite holiday classics.
At 6pm, Patricia‚Äôs Boutique Windows ‚ÄúCome to Life‚Äù with festive surprises!
Brooksville Methodist Church will have a live Nativity scene and a petting zoo in the Brooksville Commons
Tree Lighting Spectacular
Join us for the official Tree Lighting Ceremony at 7 PM and watch downtown glow with holiday cheer! A special performance by the talented Live Oak Theatre will fill the air with seasonal joy.
Meet Santa Claus
The big man himself will be waiting to hear everyone‚Äôs Christmas wishes‚Äîdon‚Äôt forget your camera!
Shop & Celebrate
Browse the Christmas Craft Market and check off your gift list at downtown shops open late. Find unique treasures and handmade goodies for everyone on your list.
Festive Flavors
Indulge in delicious bites from downtown restaurants and visiting food trucks serving up holiday-inspired treats.
A Magical Night to Remember
Come share in the holiday spirit with family and friends as we celebrate the most wonderful time of the year. This is a night you won‚Äôt want to miss!
Bundle up, bring your holiday cheer, and let‚Äôs make this a magical start to the season!

Downtown Street Market
Saturday, November 15, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
2:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
A Salute to Veterans
Join us in honoring our nation‚Äôs heroes at a special edition of the monthly Downtown Street Market! Brooksville Main Street is proud to present the final market of 2025 with a Salute to Veterans, a heartfelt tribute celebrating the service and sacrifice of our military veterans. This patriotic street market will bring the community together for a day of appreciation, local shopping, and family-friendly activities.
Join us on Saturday, November 15th, 2025 from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a bustling marketplace filled with veteran-owned businesses, handmade crafts, specialty food trucks, and unique goods. Attendees will also have the opportunity to engage with veteran organizations and learn more about ways to support our military community.
This event is not only a celebration of their service but also a way for our community to come together in gratitude and support.
The Downtown Street Market is a family-friendly and pet-friendly event, so bring your loved ones‚Äîboth two-legged and four-legged‚Äîfor a day of fun and festivities while enjoying the welcoming atmosphere of historic downtown Brooksville

Beautify Brooksville Spring 2025
Saturday, April 5, 2025
8:00‚ÄØAM
12:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!
We will be targeting the beautification of Main Street, Russell Street Park and the Train Depot as well as other downtown side streets!
This feel-good event is full of friendly faces that grow each time we meet! If you have pride in Brooksville, want to see Her flourish and have an itch to volunteer for your community, come on out!
The event will be on Saturday, April 5th from 8am-12pm.
Click this
link
to register to volunteer!
Volunteers should check-in at Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville (by the Train Depot)
to pick your beautifying task. Assignments will be provided at check in! Don't forget to wear your Beautify Brooksville t-shirt!
Thank you to the City of Brooksville and Hernando County for their community partnership.

Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!
We will be targeting the beautification of Main Street, Russell Street Park and the Train Depot as well as other downtown side streets!
This feel-good event is full of friendly faces that grow each time we meet! If you have pride in Brooksville, want to see Her flourish and have an itch to volunteer for your community, come on out!
The event will be on Saturday, April 5th from 8am-12pm.
Click this
link
to register to volunteer!
Volunteers should check-in at Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville (by the Train Depot)
to pick your beautifying task. Assignments will be provided at check in! Don't forget to wear your Beautify Brooksville t-shirt!
Thank you to the City of Brooksville and Hernando County for their community partnership.

Tangerine Ball Drop
Tuesday, December 31, 2024
7:00‚ÄØPM
Wednesday, January 1, 2025
12:55‚ÄØAM
Google Calendar
ICS
Get ready to celebrate New Year‚Äôs Eve like never before with the
Tangerine Ball Drop
, a fun and vibrant event happening on
December 31st, 2024 from 6pm-1am at the Water Tower in downtown Brooksville!
This unique celebration is bringing a colorful twist to the traditional ball drop, featuring a glowing tangerine descending to mark the start of the New Year.
The returning signature event is a festive way to usher in the New Year, complete with live music, food trucks, artisan market, VIP area, and a family-friendly atmosphere. Whether you're looking for a night of dancing, a spot to enjoy great food, or just a fun evening out with friends and family, the
Tangerine Ball Drop
has something for everyone.
This electrifying New Year's Eve celebration kicks off when
DJ Shalamar
takes the stage to spin the best of today‚Äôs favorites, classic hits, and everything in between! Known for his seamless blending of genres and infectious energy, he‚Äôs set to ignite the dance floor and keep the party going! From top chart hits to throwback favorites, partygoers can expect an epic soundtrack to usher in the New Year with style. When the
clock strikes 9pm
, families can expect a unique ball drop just for the kiddos!
The fun doesn‚Äôt stop there! Southern rock Band,
Tommy Soxx
, takes the stage at 9:30pm and shows us why they‚Äôre the best at keeping the energy high throughout the evening. They‚Äôll be joined by outgoing
Mayor Blake Bell
for a live countdown to midnight with a spectacular
Tangerine Ball Drop
and cheers from the crowd! Watch as the iconic tangerine lights up the night sky and makes its descent to welcome in the New Year.
‚ÄúOur New Year‚Äôs Eve party is all about creating a night to remember,‚Äù said Christopher Rhodes, board president of Brooksville Main Street. ‚ÄúWith
DJ Shalamar
kicking off the night and then passing the baton to southern rock band, Tommy Roxx, this is going to be the ultimate celebration to kick off 2025 in the best way possible.‚Äù
THIS IS A FREE AND FUN EVENT WTH A VIP OPTION!
VIP Experience
:
Get access to the best views of the party with our
VIP package
. Tickets are $40 per person or $75 per couple. Savor delicious food from local restaurants and enjoy signature festive drinks, and a few other surprises!
Tickets go on sale December 1st.
‚ÄúWe're thrilled to offer something so special for our community to come together and celebrate,‚Äù said Dawn Triconi, executive director of Brooksville Main Street. ‚ÄúThe Tangerine Ball Drop is a unique spin on a classic tradition, and we can't wait to ring in the New Year with our friends and neighbors.‚Äù
This year‚Äôs event promises to be the best, with the tangerine glowing brighter than ever before. Come dressed to impress or keep it casual but be sure to bring your New Year's spirit as we countdown to 2024.

About Us
We are Main Street.
As a Main Street America‚Ñ¢ Accredited program, Brooksville Main Street is a recognized leading program among the national network of more than 1,200 neighborhoods and communities who share both a commitment to creating high-quality places and to building stronger communities through preservation-based economic development. All Main Street America‚Ñ¢ Accredited programs meet a set of National Accreditation Standards of Performance as outlined by¬†Main Street America.
Brooksville Main Street is a nonprofit organization that is also an accredited member of Florida Main Street, a division of the Florida Department of State.¬† A maximum of three cities per year are chosen for Main Street America designation. Brooksville earned theirs in late 2016 officially starting the program in 2017.
Florida Main Street Reporting To date

$2,283,894.57
Private Dollars Invested

Volunteer Hours
Main Street Transformation Strategies are implemented through comprehensive work in four broad areas, known as the Four Points.
Economic Vitality
Economic vitality is about smart growth. It focuses on capital, incentives, and other economic and financial tools to assist new and existing businesses, catalyze property development, and create a supportive environment for entrepreneurs and innovators that drive local economies.
Learn more
Design
Design is about beautification. It supports a community‚Äôs transformation by enhancing the physical and visual assets that set the commercial district apart.
Learn more
Organization
Organization is about collaboration. It involves creating a strong foundation for a sustainable revitalization effort, including cultivating partnerships, community involvement, and resources for the district.
Learn more
Promotion
Promotion is about placemaking. It positions the downtown or commercial district as the center of the community and hub of economic activity while creating a positive image that showcases a community‚Äôs unique characteristics.
Learn more
Main Street America
began in 1980 as an innovative way to revitalize downtown areas.¬† The philosophy worked, and since then has been used in communities across America to make downtowns (and thus their cities) healthy.
Florida Main Street
provides oversight for the programs in our state. They provide training, development, and important networking invaluable to us.
What is the Main Street District?
Brooksville Main Street‚Äô District has the same boundaries as the City Community Redevelopment Agency (
view map
). Businesses and residences in the district qualify for special grants, promotions, and assistance from both BMS and the City of Brooksville.
‚ÄúNever doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.‚Äù
- Margaret Mead

The Friday Night Live Concert Series brings the community together for a night of family fun with live music, an artisan market, great food, and a full bar. The concert takes place in Hernando Park. The show begins at 6:30 PM and features local Florida talent.
Visit our
Facebook page
for more details or our
event calendar
for more information.
BAND:
Peace of Woodstock
Held on the 2nd Friday of the month (excluding summer months and December) from 6:30pm-9:30pm in downtown Brooksville.

page for food, non-food and entertainment opportunities.

Downtown Street Market
Saturday, April 19, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
2:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Experience the charm of historic downtown Brooksville like never before at the Downtown Street Market, where local artisans, food vendors, and small businesses come together to create a vibrant shopping experience! This month, we‚Äôre excited to introduce a special new feature ‚Äì the
Critter Corner Market
, dedicated to pet lovers and animal enthusiasts.
Join us on Saturday, April 19th, 2025, from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a lively marketplace filled with unique handcrafted goods, fresh produce, and delicious food. With the addition of
Critter Corner Market
, visitors will also find a variety of pet-friendly vendors, locally made pet products, and even adorable adoptable animals looking for their fur-ever homes!

Moonlight Movies
Saturday, July 12, 2025
7:00‚ÄØPM
11:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Moonlight Movies
is a fun, family event! Bring a blanket, a chair  or both and enjoy the night time breeze while watching a movie at our Bandshell in gorgeous Hernando Park! The event is
FREE
to the public and includes
FREE
downtown parking and the opportunity to stroll throughout downtown enjoying restaurants, merchants, and retail stores!
There will also be food trucks, arts and crafts merchants and a few other surprises!
Moana 2
Wayfinding Under the Stars!
Water Balloon Lava Toss:
Participants can toss water balloons back and forth, pretending the ground is lava! Use "island" safe zones to catch the balloons.
Heart of Te Fiti Stone Painting:
Paint "Heart of Te Fiti" stones
Costume Contest: "Wayfinders and Warriors Costume Contest"
Best Moana Look-Alike:
For kids dressed as Moana, including her iconic outfit with the flower crown or sash.
Most Creative Ocean Spirit:
Recognize unique costumes inspired by the ocean (like Te Fiti, waves, or sea creatures).
Best Maui Impersonation:
Award the best Maui costume, complete with tattoos, a magical fish hook, or a creative spin on his look.
Cutest Little Kakamora:
A prize for those dressed as the mischievous Kakamora coconut creatures.
Best Family/Group Costume:
Celebrate families or friends who dress up as a group (e.g., Moana, Maui, Gramma Tala, Hei Hei, and Pua).

Wayfinding Under the Stars!
Water Balloon Lava Toss:
Participants can toss water balloons back and forth, pretending the ground is lava! Use "island" safe zones to catch the balloons.
Heart of Te Fiti Stone Painting:
Paint "Heart of Te Fiti" stones
Costume Contest: "Wayfinders and Warriors Costume Contest"
Best Moana Look-Alike:
For kids dressed as Moana, including her iconic outfit with the flower crown or sash.
Most Creative Ocean Spirit:
Recognize unique costumes inspired by the ocean (like Te Fiti, waves, or sea creatures).
Best Maui Impersonation:
Award the best Maui costume, complete with tattoos, a magical fish hook, or a creative spin on his look.
Cutest Little Kakamora:
A prize for those dressed as the mischievous Kakamora coconut creatures.
Best Family/Group Costume:
Celebrate families or friends who dress up as a group (e.g., Moana, Maui, Gramma Tala, Hei Hei, and Pua).

8
to Nov 9
9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit
Sat, Nov 8, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
Sun, Nov 9, 2025
4:30‚ÄØPM
115 North Main Street
Brooksville, FL, 34601
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville!
This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes.
Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day.
Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories.
The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville.
The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates:
Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM
Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET.
Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at
T2T.org.

This patriotic street market will bring the community together for a day of appreciation, local shopping, and family-friendly activities.
Join us on Saturday, November 15th, 2025 from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a bustling marketplace filled with veteran-owned businesses, handmade crafts, specialty food trucks, and unique goods. Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!
We will be targeting the beautification of Main Street, Russell Street Park and the Train Depot as well as other downtown side streets!
This feel-good event is full of friendly faces that grow each time we meet! If you have pride in Brooksville, want to see Her flourish and have an itch to volunteer for your community, come on out!
The event will be on Saturday, April 5th from 8am-12pm.
Click this
link
to register to volunteer!
Volunteers should check-in at Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville (by the Train Depot) to pick your beautifying task. Assignments will be provided at check in! Don't forget to wear your Beautify Brooksville t-shirt!
Thank you to the City of Brooksville and Hernando County for their community partnership.

Pedal Play Day Rolls into Brooksville to Celebrate the Good Neighbor Trail
Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida‚Äôs Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host
Pedal Play Day
, a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail.
Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to join us on
Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm
in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun.
Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism.
The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your bike and helmet!
We‚Äôll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths.
This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others.

9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit
Sat, Nov 8, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
Sun, Nov 9, 2025
4:30‚ÄØPM
115 North Main Street
Brooksville, FL, 34601
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville!
This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes.
Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day.
Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories.
The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville.
The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates:
Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM
Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET.
Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at
T2T.org.

Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!
We will be targeting the beautification of Main Street, Russell Street Park and the Train Depot as well as other downtown side streets!
This feel-good event is full of friendly faces that grow each time we meet! If you have pride in Brooksville, want to see Her flourish and have an itch to volunteer for your community, come on out!
The event will be on Saturday, April 5th from 8am-12pm.

link
to register to volunteer!

Thank you to the City of Brooksville and Hernando County for their community partnership.

Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida‚Äôs Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host

, a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail.

Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm
in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun.
Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism.
The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your bike and helmet!
We‚Äôll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths.
This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others.

9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit

Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville!
This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes.
Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day.
Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories.
The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville.
The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates:
Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM
Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET.
Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at
T2T.org.

This patriotic street market will bring the community together for a day of appreciation, local shopping, and family-friendly activities.
Join us on Saturday, November 15th, 2025 from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a bustling marketplace filled with veteran-owned businesses, handmade crafts, specialty food trucks, and unique goods. Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!

Pedal Play Day Rolls into Brooksville to Celebrate the Good Neighbor Trail
Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida‚Äôs Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host
Pedal Play Day
, a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail.
Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to join us on
Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm
in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun.
Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism.
The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your bike and helmet!
We‚Äôll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths.
This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others.

that marks the beginning of a new tradition in Brooksville, celebrating the area‚Äôs rich agricultural history and its enduring connection to Florida‚Äôs citrus industry.

9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit
Sat, Nov 8, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
Sun, Nov 9, 2025
4:30‚ÄØPM
115 North Main Street
Brooksville, FL, 34601
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville!
This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes.
Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day.
Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories.
The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville.
The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates:
Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM
Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET.
Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at
T2T.org.

Beautify Brooksville Spring 2025
Saturday, April 5, 2025
8:00‚ÄØAM
12:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Calling all landscapers, gardeners, pressure washers, residents and downtown advocates! The Spring edition of Beautify Brooksville is now underway!
Join the Brooksville Main Street Board of Directors and the Design Committee for the biannual downtown cleanup as we pull up our sleeves to clean, weed, paint, pressure wash and take care of this gorgeous City that we call home!
We will be targeting the beautification of Main Street, Russell Street Park and the Train Depot as well as other downtown side streets!
This feel-good event is full of friendly faces that grow each time we meet! If you have pride in Brooksville, want to see Her flourish and have an itch to volunteer for your community, come on out!
The event will be on Saturday, April 5th from 8am-12pm.
Click this
link
to register to volunteer!
Volunteers should check-in at Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville (by the Train Depot) to pick your beautifying task. Assignments will be provided at check in! Don't forget to wear your Beautify Brooksville t-shirt!
Thank you to the City of Brooksville and Hernando County for their community partnership.

ICS
Pedal Play Day Rolls into Brooksville to Celebrate the Good Neighbor Trail
Get ready to ride! Brooksville Main Street in partnership with Florida‚Äôs Adventure Coast Brooksville Weeki Wachee and Bike Florida is excited to host
Pedal Play Day
, a fun-filled community event celebrating the Good Neighbor Trail.
Cyclists of all ages and skill levels are invited to join us on
Saturday, March 22nd from 10am-2pm
in Russell Street Park located at 28 Russell Street in downtown Brooksville for a day of biking, family activities, and local fun.
Pedal Play Day aims to inspire a love for cycling, foster community engagement, and raise awareness of the Good Neighbor Trail as a resource for health, recreation, and eco-tourism.
The event will feature group rides, safety demonstrations, a bicycle decorating station, interactive stations promoting fitness and wellness and special appearances from local cycling enthusiasts. Attendees can also explore local vendor booths, food trucks, and participate in prize giveaways. Don‚Äôt forget to bring your bike and helmet!
We‚Äôll also have bicycle rides through the Good Neighbor Trail throughout the day of varying lengths.
This family-friendly event encourages cycling for all ages and skill levels, providing a safe and engaging environment for participants to explore the trail and connect with others.

FREE EVENT
with

that marks the beginning of a new tradition in Brooksville, celebrating the area‚Äôs rich agricultural history and its enduring connection to Florida‚Äôs citrus industry.
This year‚Äôs event will feature:
Live Music:
Downtown Brooksville will be rocking all day with back-to-back performances on two stages packed with live music! Enjoy a lineup of local bands and headlining performers, ensuring there‚Äôs something for every music lover. Get ready to dance, sing, and celebrate our veterans with an unforgettable day of music!
Bandshell in Hernando Park:
11:30am-1:30pm
Draw 4
2:30pm-4:30pm
WOR Women of Rock Tribute Band
5:30pm-7:30pm
Southbound 75
‚ÄúHomegrown‚Äù Stage

Performances by local musicians, dance troops and artists, including genres from rock and country to blues and patriotic tunes.
Tangerine Treasure Market:
A vibrant market featuring local arts, crafts, and retail vendors offering a wide variety of unique goods. From handcrafted jewelry and artwork to custom-made clothing, home d√©cor, and specialty gifts, there's something for everyone.
Family Fun Zone:
Fun for all ages awaits! Enjoy exciting photo opportunities throughout the event, face painting, balloon art, and a captivating magician performing tricks that will delight both kids and adults. The zone will also include a Bubble Foam Party! Fun for the entire family!
Tangerine-Inspired Treats:
Indulge in culinary creations featuring tangerines, from pizzas and jams to refreshing drinks from our downtown restaurants and local food trucks.
Tangerine Education:
Learn about the history of tangerine farming in Brooksville
through interactive displays and demonstrations.

Explore Historic Downtown Brooksville!
Downtown Brooksville has numerous tours and activities to keep you and your family and friends busy throughout the year. Check out all we‚Äôve got to offer, and stop by the local tourism office to learn more about Brooksville and Hernando County as a whole.
We strive for accuracy in our directory. If you come across any missing listings, kindly
contact us
to let us know, and we'll make sure to update it promptly. Your engagement helps us create a better experience for everyone!
The Boho Wedding Venue
Step into a world of natural beauty and rustic charm at the Boho Wedding Venue, where dream weddings come to life. Nestled in a serene setting, this venue offers a picturesque atmosphere perfect for couples looking for a relaxed yet elegant bohemian-inspired celebration. With its eclectic mix of lush greenery and open spaces, the venue provides the ideal backdrop for intimate ceremonies and joyful receptions. Whether you're exchanging vows under the canopy of trees or dancing the night away in an open-air space, the Boho Wedding Venue offers a unique, personalized experience that captures the free-spirited essence of your love story.
105 S Saxon Ave, Brooksville, FL 34601
Website
Brooksville Common
Brooksville Common is a vibrant community hub designed to bring people together in the spirit of creativity, connection, and local pride. More than just a venue, this thoughtfully curated space serves as a gathering point for residents and visitors alike‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre looking for a place to unwind or pray.
The Brooksville Common provides a welcoming backdrop for meaningful moments and memorable experiences. The open-air layout and flexible event space make it ideal for both casual meetups and large-scale celebrations, while its central location puts it right in the flow of Brooksville‚Äôs growing local scene.
15 S Broad St, Brooksville, FL 34601
Facebook Page
Brooksville Gallery 201
Brooksville Gallery 201 is a cornerstone of the local arts community, offering a dynamic and inspiring space where creativity thrives and local talent takes center stage. Located on the second floor of City Hall, the gallery showcases a rotating collection of work from regional artists across a variety of mediums‚Äîpainting, sculpture, photography, mixed media, and more‚Äîcelebrating both established creators and emerging voices.
More than just a gallery, Brooksville Gallery 201 serves as a cultural gathering place, hosting artist receptions, curated exhibitions, and community art events that invite visitors to engage with the creative process. Each exhibit is thoughtfully selected to reflect the spirit and diversity of the local art scene, offering fresh perspectives and storytelling through visual expression.
201 Howell Ave, Brooksville, F 34601
Website
Brooksville Main Street Office
Our Hub! ‚Äî Brooksville Main Street serves as the driving force behind the revitalization and celebration of historic downtown Brooksville. As part of the nationally recognized Main Street America program, we are a local organization works tirelessly to preserve the charm, character, and cultural heritage of the area while promoting economic growth and community engagement.
Through strategic planning, local partnerships, and a deep passion for placemaking, the Brooksville Main Street team curates a vibrant calendar of events, beautification projects, and business support initiatives designed to enrich the downtown experience for residents and visitors alike. From lively festivals and markets to public art installations and small business spotlights, their work plays a vital role in shaping Brooksville into a thriving destination full of energy, creativity, and local pride.
Brooksville Main Street isn‚Äôt just an organization‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement dedicated to fostering a stronger, more connected community by honoring the past and building an exciting, inclusive future. Whether you‚Äôre a business owner, resident, or visitor, the Brooksville Main Street effort aims to help make downtown Brooksville a place where everyone feels welcome, inspired, and at home.
205 E Fort Dade Ave. Brooksville, FL 34601
Website
Countryman Family One Room Schoolhouse
The Countryman Family One-Room Schoolhouse offers a charming and immersive glimpse into Florida‚Äôs educational past. This loving piece of local history transports visitors back to a simpler time, where chalkboards, wooden desks, and slate tablets were the tools of learning. Tucked away in Russell Street Park, the schoolhouse stands as both a tribute to early rural education and a testament to the families‚Äîlike the Countrymans‚Äîwho valued learning as the foundation of community.
Originally built to reflect the one-room schoolhouses of the late 19th and early 20th centuries, the space aims to reflect its historical significance. It serves as a hands-on educational site, offering tours, field trips, and special programming for students, history buffs, and curious visitors of all ages.
66 Russell St, Brooksville, FL 34601

Florida Mermaid Trail
The Florida Mermaid Trail invites visitors to explore Brooksville in the most whimsical way‚Äîthrough a self-guided walking adventure that blends local history, public art, and a touch of magic. Winding through the charming streets of historic downtown, this imaginative trail challenges participants to find over two dozen hidden mermaid sculptures tucked away in unexpected spots‚Äîfrom shop windows to building corners‚Äîeach one adding a splash of mystery and fun to the journey.
Created to celebrate Brooksville‚Äôs connection to nearby Weeki Wachee and its world-famous mermaids, the trail offers two routes: a shorter, family-friendly path and a longer, more adventurous version for those looking to discover every secret the city has to offer. Along the way, walkers are encouraged to explore local shops, restaurants, and historic landmarks, turning the experience into both a playful scavenger hunt and a deeper dive into Brooksville‚Äôs vibrant culture.

GFWC Historic Brooksville Women's Club
A cherished part of the community since its founding, the
Brooksville Woman‚Äôs Club
stands as a symbol of service, tradition, and female leadership in Hernando County. Rooted in a rich history of civic engagement and philanthropy, the club continues to bring women together across generations to make a meaningful impact‚Äîboth locally and beyond.
Housed in a beautifully maintained historic building in downtown Brooksville, the club serves as a gathering place for members and community events alike. From organizing charity drives and educational programs to hosting luncheons, fundraisers, and cultural activities, the Brooksville Woman‚Äôs Club remains deeply involved in initiatives that uplift and strengthen the community. Its members are passionate about preserving history, promoting the arts, supporting youth, and advocating for causes that matter.
131 S. Main Street, Brooksville, FL 34601

Good Neighbor Trail
The
Good Neighbor Trail
offers a peaceful and picturesque escape for walkers, runners, and cyclists alike, weaving through the natural beauty and quiet charm of Brooksville and beyond. Stretching over 10 miles, this paved multi-use trail begins in historic downtown Brooksville and connects to the
Withlacoochee State Trail
, creating an inviting corridor for outdoor recreation and exploration across Hernando County.
Formerly a stretch of railroad line, the trail has been thoughtfully transformed into a safe, accessible path that winds through tree-lined landscapes, gentle hills, and glimpses of rural Florida life. It‚Äôs an ideal route for daily exercise, leisurely weekend rides, or connecting with friends on a scenic stroll. Along the way, trail users will find rest areas, shaded spots, and access points that make it easy to enjoy whether you're in it for a mile or the full route.
Trailhead: 70 Russell Street Brooksville, FL 34601
The Hardware Store
Eclectic, moody and one-of-a-kind! Transforming a classic hardware store into a one-of-a-kind event space, The Hardware Store combines rustic charm with modern flair. Featuring exposed brick walls, vintage fixtures, and spacious open areas, this venue offers a distinctive setting for a variety of events, from weddings and corporate gatherings to intimate parties and community celebrations. The venue‚Äôs unique blend of industrial character and warm ambiance creates an inviting atmosphere, making it a perfect choice for those seeking a memorable and unconventional event space. With flexibility in design and a dedicated team to assist with every detail, The Hardware Store ensures your event is as extraordinary as the venue itself.
115 N. Main Street, Brooksville, FL, United States, 34601
Facebook
Hernando Park
Hernando Park
is a vibrant community hub that offers a perfect blend of outdoor recreation, relaxation, and local entertainment. This beautifully maintained park is home to a variety of amenities, including tennis courts, a library, pickleball courts, and the iconic bandshell‚Äîwhere the popular
Friday Night Live
events bring the community together for live music and good times.
Whether you‚Äôre hitting the courts for a friendly match or enjoying a leisurely afternoon picnic beneath the park‚Äôs towering oaks, Hernando Park offers something for everyone. The well-kept tennis and pickleball courts draw sports enthusiasts year-round, while the bandshell serves as the backdrop for concerts, performances, and cultural celebrations throughout the year.
With its lush green spaces, shaded pathways, and family-friendly playground, Hernando Park is a popular destination for both locals and visitors alike. From fitness enthusiasts to those simply looking for a peaceful retreat, this park is more than just a place to unwind‚Äîit‚Äôs where the heart of Brooksville beats, with every event, game, and gathering contributing to the town‚Äôs vibrant sense of community.
205 E Fort Dade Ave, Brooksville, FL 34601
Website
May Stringer House & Museum
The
May-Stringer House
stands as one of Brooksville‚Äôs most iconic landmarks, offering a deep dive into the rich history and haunted charm of the area. Built in the late 1800s, this Victorian-style home is not only a stunning example of architecture from that era but also one of the oldest standing buildings in Hernando County. Once a family residence, it has since been transformed into a historic house museum, where visitors can explore period rooms, antique furnishings, and stories that span generations of Brooksville‚Äôs past.
Known for its fascinating history, the May-Stringer House is often considered one of Florida's most haunted locations, with paranormal enthusiasts frequently visiting to explore its eerie past. Guided tours through the house bring the history of the property to life, from its early days as a home for the May and Stringer families to its later use as a place for community gatherings and local legends. Visitors can step back in time as they wander through rooms decorated in 19th-century style, learning about the building‚Äôs role in shaping the community and hearing tales of the many spirits said to still reside there.
Check out their ghost tours as well!
601 Museum Ct., Brooksville, FL 34601

Mural Tour
The
Hernando County Art Council Mural Tour
is an artistic journey through downtown Brooksville and beyond, celebrating the rich cultural landscape of Hernando County. This self-guided tour features a stunning collection of public murals that tell the story of the area‚Äôs history, heritage, and community spirit. Each mural, painted by talented local and regional artists, transforms ordinary walls into vibrant works of art that bring the town‚Äôs streets to life.
As you walk through downtown Brooksville, you‚Äôll encounter murals that depict everything from historic moments and local wildlife to abstract expressions and modern interpretations. The murals are strategically placed around the city, allowing visitors to experience not only the art but also the charm of Brooksville‚Äôs historic architecture and bustling local businesses.
Visit the Hernando County Art Council's website to learn more about this interactive walking tour!

Russell Street Park
Russell Street Park
is a hidden gem that provides a serene retreat for residents and visitors alike. This inviting park offers a perfect blend of green space, recreational facilities, and natural beauty, making it a favorite destination for outdoor activities and family gatherings.
The park features well-maintained walking paths, picnic areas, and plenty of open space for play and relaxation. Its large grassy areas are perfect for children to run and play, while families can enjoy picnics under the shade of towering trees. Home to the Good Neighbor Trailhead!
28 Russell St, Brooksville, FL 34601
TourBVL Historic Walking Tour
TourBVL
is your gateway to discovering the hidden gems of Brooksville, FL, with expertly guided tours that bring the town‚Äôs rich history, local culture, and vibrant community to life in the palm of your hand. Whether you're a first-time visitor or a long-time resident, TourBVL offers a personalized, engaging experience that highlights the best of what Brooksville has to offer.
It‚Äôs as simple as scanning the tangerine QR codes located on the historic buildings all throughout downtown. Learn about the history of the building and see old photos!
Visit the TourBVL website to learn more about the historic buildings in Downtown Brooksville!

The 1885 Train Depot Museum
Step back in time at the
1885 Train Depot Museum
, a historic gem that showcases the rich railroad history of Brooksville and Hernando County. Located in Russell Street Park this beautifully restored depot is a living tribute to the pivotal role that the railroad played in shaping the community during the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
Originally built in 1885, the depot served as a bustling transportation hub that connected Brooksville to the wider world, facilitating the growth of local industries and making it a key player in the region‚Äôs development. Today, the
1885 Train Depot Museum
offers visitors a chance to explore the artifacts, photographs, and exhibits that tell the story of the railroad‚Äôs influence on the town‚Äôs history. From vintage train memorabilia and historical documents to detailed models of early locomotives, every corner of the museum provides a fascinating glimpse into the past.
70 Russell St, Brooksville, FL 34601

What excites you about the work of Brooksville Main Street?
ATTRIBUTES
A board is more than a collection of individuals. It is an entity that  participates in the success of the organization. It is a entity that governs, approves strategy and is actively engaged. As such, the personality traits you bring to the board will help us to ensure we have a diversity of personality styes and traits that, when added to our current board mebers, will enhance the ability of the board members to work together as a governing body.

Strong work ethic
Good sense of humor
Asks tough questions with respect

We expect every board member to make an annual financial commitment for each year of board service at a leverl you are comfortable with.

My primary duty as a Board Member is to promote the program to the community and commit to do so.
I understand Board Members are required to contribute to the program through in-kind or cash donations.

Brooksville Main Street
is excited to host a special edition of the market featuring a Fall Festival and Chili Cook-Off, bringing the community together for a celebration of all things fall.
Join us on Saturday, October 18th, from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM as S Brooksville Ave transforms into a lively marketplace filled with seasonal d√©cor, handmade crafts, and specialty food vendors. Visitors can explore a variety of fall-themed treats, shop unique artisan goods, and enjoy festive activities for the whole family!
Chili Cook-Off Showdown!
One of this month‚Äôs market highlights will be a fun Chili Cook-Off where local chefs and home cooks will compete for the title of Best Chili in Brooksville!
Attendees can sample a variety of chili recipes and vote for their favorite while enjoying entertainment and the warm, welcoming atmosphere of historic downtown.

Guests can also enjoy music, kids' activities, and festive photo opportunities, making it a can‚Äôt-miss event for all ages.

9/11 Never Forget Mobile Exhibit
Saturday, November 8, 2025
10:00‚ÄØAM
Sunday, November 9, 2025
4:30‚ÄØPM
115 North Main Street
Brooksville, FL, 34601
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Brooksville Main Street is honored to welcome back the powerful Tunnel to Towers Foundation 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to downtown Brooksville!
This moving experience offers a profound opportunity to remember the events of September 11, 2001, and pay tribute to the enduring sacrifices made by so many heroes.
Step inside this 83-foot tractor-trailer, transformed into an 1,100-square-foot mobile museum, and encounter poignant artifacts from Ground Zero, including World Trade Center steel and fragments from that fateful day.
Hear firsthand accounts from retired New York City Firefighters and first responders who were there, as they share their powerful experiences and memories.
The return of the Tunnel to Towers 9/11 NEVER FORGET Mobile Exhibit to Brooksville has been made possible through the generous support of Buick GMC Brooksville, Advent Health Dade City and Massage Envy Spring Hill Brooksville.
The exhibit will be open to the public on these dates:
Saturday, November 8th: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM
Sunday, November 9th: 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Let us come together as a community to NEVER FORGET.
Learn more about the vital work of the Tunnel to Towers Foundation at
T2T.org.

2025 Event OPPORTUNITIES
Event details
Thank you for your interest in participating in Brooksville Main Street Events! Should you have any questions, please reach out to us @ 352-540-6409 or email: eventdirector@welovebvl.org
Step 1: COMPLETE THE form below.
Limited spaces are available. We do not offer exclusivity. All merchants and vendors are welcome.
Step 2: Await a response from our team.
We will be in contact with you within 72 hours to let you know of acceptance and rejection for this event.
Step 3: Submit your booth fee.
After we review your application, you will receive an email with the confirmation of event(s) and a payment link.  At this time, we accept credit cards, cash or check.  If paying by cash or check, please visit our Brooksville Main Street office. Please note: your booth is not confirmed until payment has been confirmed.

Thank you for supporting our mission
Thank you for BECOMING PART of the mAIN sTREEt fAMILY!
With your help, Brooksville Main Street can increase its ability to help a small town, grow smart. Help us collaborate and support those who live, shop and play in downtown Brooksville. We hope you will continue to
invest in your community by making your tax-deductible contribution today!
BMS is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, accredited with the Florida Main Street and Main Street America programs. Our funding comes from City and County grants, investors, events and programs as well as charitable contributions such as yours.
Brooksville Main Street builds value and appeal of downtown by supporting business development, promoting a positive image and revitalization of the core community. Our organization uses an inclusive approach to involved all stakeholders through community involvement and volunteerism.
We are proud of our Supporters and we like to show it.  When you become a downtown supporter, you become part of the Main Street Family! You are truly the core to our vibrant community.  Your support is an investment in the future of Brooksville.

EXPLORE MAIN STREET AND DISCOVER WHAT MAKES OUR STREETS SO UNIQUE.
Shop. Dine. Entertain. Unwind.
Early pioneers made Brooksville their place of choice for shopping in the 19th century. Today, you can walk those same streets, some still brick-lined with historic Augusta Block Brick, and shop¬†in those same buildings.¬†You will find unique specialty items, home accessories, jewelry, and many other one-of-a-kind gifts rather than pelts and barrels of nails.¬†Whether you're looking for the perfect gift or just want to treat yourself to something special, there's something on Main Street to suit every taste.
When you're hungry, today's visitors have several restaurants from which to choose.¬†Satisfy your palate with anything from pizza to tapas and choose your atmosphere - enjoy an outdoor setting, historic ambiance, a local brewery, or a coffee house. Make your own memories along Brooksville's Main Street.

Family Sensory Christmas Celebration
Thursday, December 19, 2024
4:00‚ÄØPM
9:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
This holiday season,
Brooksville Main Street
is excited to announce the
2nd Annual Family Sensory Christmas Celebration
on
Thursday, December 19th 2024 at Hernando Park located at 205 E Ft Dade Ave in Brooksville
. This special event is designed to create a magical and inclusive holiday experience for families with children of all abilities, especially those with sensory sensitivities.
Understanding that the hustle and bustle of traditional holiday events can be overwhelming for some children,
Brooksville Main Street
has developed a sensory-friendly celebration that allows families to enjoy the magic of Christmas in a more comfortable and supportive environment.
Event Highlights Include:
¬∑
Sensory-Sensitive Santa Visit:
Santa will greet children in a calm and quiet setting, offering an opportunity for personalized interactions without the long lines and loud noises.
¬∑
Low-Sensory Activities:
A variety of holiday-themed crafts, sensory play stations, and activities designed to engage the senses in a gentle, stress-free way.
¬∑
Quiet Zones:
Designated quiet areas will be available for families to take a break, relax, or decompress as needed.
¬∑
Adaptive Lighting and Sound:
The event will feature soft lighting and lower sound levels to reduce sensory overload and ensure a more comfortable experience for everyone.
¬∑
Inclusive Environment:
Volunteers trained to support children with sensory needs will be on hand to assist and ensure every child feels welcome and supported.
¬∑
Movie Magic Meadow
: Enjoy a classic Christmas film in a Candyland setting
¬∑
Christmas Craft Market
: where local artisans, crafters, and food vendors gather to bring you a festive shopping experience.
‚ÄúWe wanted to create a holiday experience that truly welcomes all families, especially those who may find traditional events challenging,‚Äù said Christopher Rhodes, Board President of Brooksville Main Street. ‚Äú
The Family Sensory Christmas Celebration
is a joyful, inclusive event that allows everyone to enjoy the magic of the season in their own way.‚Äù
This event is free and open to the public.

Brooksville Main Street
is excited to announce the
2nd Annual Family Sensory Christmas Celebration
on
Thursday, December 19th 2024 at Hernando Park located at 205 E Ft Dade Ave in Brooksville
. This special event is designed to create a magical and inclusive holiday experience for families with children of all abilities, especially those with sensory sensitivities.
Understanding that the hustle and bustle of traditional holiday events can be overwhelming for some children,
Brooksville Main Street
has developed a sensory-friendly celebration that allows families to enjoy the magic of Christmas in a more comfortable and supportive environment.
Event Highlights Include:
¬∑
Sensory-Sensitive Santa Visit:
Santa will greet children in a calm and quiet setting, offering an opportunity for personalized interactions without the long lines and loud noises.
¬∑
Low-Sensory Activities:
A variety of holiday-themed crafts, sensory play stations, and activities designed to engage the senses in a gentle, stress-free way.
¬∑
Quiet Zones:
Designated quiet areas will be available for families to take a break, relax, or decompress as needed.
¬∑
Adaptive Lighting and Sound:
The event will feature soft lighting and lower sound levels to reduce sensory overload and ensure a more comfortable experience for everyone.
¬∑
Inclusive Environment:
Volunteers trained to support children with sensory needs will be on hand to assist and ensure every child feels welcome and supported.
¬∑
Movie Magic Meadow
: Enjoy a classic Christmas film in a Candyland setting
¬∑
Christmas Craft Market
: where local artisans, crafters, and food vendors gather to bring you a festive shopping experience.
‚ÄúWe wanted to create a holiday experience that truly welcomes all families, especially those who may find traditional events challenging,‚Äù said Christopher Rhodes, Board President of Brooksville Main Street. ‚Äú
The Family Sensory Christmas Celebration
is a joyful, inclusive event that allows everyone to enjoy the magic of the season in their own way.‚Äù
This event is free and open to the public.

Moonlight Movies
Saturday, August 9, 2025
7:00‚ÄØPM
11:00‚ÄØPM
Google Calendar
ICS
Moonlight Movies
is a fun, family event! Bring a blanket, a chair  or both and enjoy the night time breeze while watching a movie at our Bandshell in gorgeous Hernando Park! The event is
FREE
to the public and includes
FREE
downtown parking and the opportunity to stroll throughout downtown enjoying restaurants, merchants, and retail stores!
But the magic starts before the movie! Get ready for delicious pre-movie festivities with our fantastic local DJ Shalamar, including themed activities, local food vendors, and fun surprises for everyone!
Arrive early to take part in the exciting Golden Ticket Hunt, where lucky winners will snag special prizes!
Other sweet activities include a Candy-dash relay, a Wonka-Inspired Costume Contest (dress up as Willy Wonka or your favorite Oompa Loompa!), a Candy Jar Guessing Game, and a few more surprise treats!
And that's not all! We'll also be hosting a backpack & school supply giveaway generously sponsored by DJ Shalamar!
The event is
FREE
to the public and includes free downtown parking, giving you the perfect opportunity to stroll through downtown and support our wonderful local restaurants and shops!
Brooksville Main Street
is dedicated to creating engaging and family-friendly events that bring our community together. Don't miss this incredible opportunity to experience the wonder of Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory under the night sky with your loved ones.
We extend our sincere gratitude to our incredible community sponsors for their partnership in making the Moonlight Movies series possible in downtown Brooksville: our Pinnacle Partner, the City of Brooksville, and our fantastic Presenting Co-Sponsors: Accent Carpet & Tile Patriot Pole Barns, World Wide NDT and the Kids Caf√©!
Their incredible partnership is what allows us to bring these free, family-friendly evenings of movie magic to our community. We couldn't do it without their support! Be sure to show them some love!
Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (1971)
Get your GOLDEN Ticket!
Golden Ticket Hunt:
Golden Tickets will be hidden around the park, and participants can redeem them for small prizes!
Chocolate River Relay:
A fun relay race where participants balance "candy"¬† on spoons as they navigate a course.
Costume Contest:
Participants can dress up for a costume contest as either an Oompa Loompa or Wonka himself!
